color
The operator for setting the color.
The operator is used in "Algorithm. Condition for visual"
type
algorithms.
Syntax
"name"
Setting
Purpose
name
The color according to the HTML format.
The parameter value can be passed by:
color code in HEX format, for example:
"#FFFFFF"
;
color name in English in lowercase, for example:
"blue"
;
* color code in RGB format, for example:
"rgb(255, 0, 0)"
.
The parameter value must be enclosed in double or single quotes.
Note
The operator is called from
"Sources" tab
on the toolbar of the algorithm editor, which opens the color picker with the option to select a color on the palette or enter a color code in RGBA and HEX formats.
It is also possible to select a color palette through a drop-down menu.
When selecting a color, a HEX color code enclosed in double quotes will be added to the algorithm code.
Use example
It is required to customizing the highlighting of the "Task status" attribute depending on the specified value.
This task can be accomplished by configuring the widget
"Title by attribute"
. To do this, in
the visual editing mode of an instance
, drag the widget from the "Elements" panel to the workspace, then specify the "Task status" attribute in the settings and set the value style algorithm:
The color for the attribute value is determined using an algorithm:
the
if
operator sets a condition, depending on which the
return
function returns the desired color or
formatting style
of the text;
the color is selected using the
color
operator, the formatting style is set using the
style
operator.
As a result of the configuration, the task status will be displayed depending on the attribute value:
When working with the "Title by attribute" widget, the default text color is black.
If the style algorithm returns only color, it will be applied to the text background.
The text color can be set by customizing the formatting style.
